metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3526 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in Linux Kernel. This vulnerability affects the function macvlan_handle_frame of the file drivers/net/macvlan.c of the component skb. The manipulation leads to memory leak. The attack can be initiated remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211024. It was discovered that a memory leak existed in the macvlan driver in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-10-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required
